bank.topic: PDE08 - Serverless Data Processing with Dataflow: Develop Pipelines

entry.question: How many times will be the process/processElement method of a DoFn called?

option.detail: This is a runner specific value. It depends on the runner.
As many times as elements are in the PCollection.
As many times as data bundles are in the PCollection.

entry.question: What is CoGroupByKey used for?

option.detail: To join data in different PCollections that share a common key and a common value type.
To group by a key when there are more than two key groups (with 2 key groups, you use GroupByKey)
To join data in different PCollections that share a common key.

entry.question: When a PTransform receives a PCollection...

option.detail: it creates a new PCollection as output, it does not change the incoming PCollection.
you may select whether the PTransform will modify the PCollection or not.
it modifies the PCollection to apply the required transformations.

entry.question: How many triggers can a window have?

option.detail: As many as we set.
One or none.
Exactly one.

entry.question: What can you do if two messages arrive at your pipeline out of order?

option.detail: You cannot do anything to recover the order of the messages.
You can recover the order of the messages with a window using processing time.
You can recover the order of the messages with a window using event time.

entry.question: How does Apache Beam decide that a message is late?

option.detail: A message is late if its timestamp is before the clock of the worker where it is processed.
A message is late if its timestamp is before the watermark.
This is a runner-specific value. It depends on the runner.

entry.question: What are the types of windows that you can use with Beam?

option.detail: Open and closed windows.
It depends on the runner, because each runner has different types of windows.
Fixed, sliding, and session windows.

entry.question: What is the simplest form of a sink?

option.detail: Built-in primitive function
PTransform
PSink
PCollection

entry.question: What kinds of data are a bounded and an unbounded source respectively associated with?

option.detail: Structured data and unstructured data.
Time-series data and graph data.
Small data and Big Data.
Batch data and streaming data.

entry.question: Which of the following element types can be encoded as a Schema from a PCollection (Select ALL that apply)?

option.detail: Byte String objects
Single list of JSON objects
Protobuf objects
Avro objects

entry.question: Is it possible to mix elements in Schema PCollections inside a single Beam pipeline (Select ALL that apply)?

option.detail: Yes, but only across different PCollections
Not possible within the same PCollection
Not at all
Yes in all scenarios

entry.question: With ParDo, you...

option.detail: can do aggregations using state variables in a DoFn.
cannot do any type of aggregations.

entry.question: What is the use case of timers in the State and Timers API of Beam?

option.detail: Timers are used in combination with state variables, to ensure that the state is cleared at regular intervals of time.
You can use timers instead of state variables to do timely aggregations.

entry.question: Which functions of the DoFn lifecycle are recommended to be used for micro-batching?

option.detail: init and destroy
setup and teardown
startBundle and finishBundle

entry.question: What is the recommended way to convert JSON objects to POJOs?

option.detail: Use JsonToPOJO
Use JsonToRow

entry.question: Choose all the applicable options: If your pipelines interact with external systems,

option.detail: Not provisioning external systems appropriately may impact the performance of your pipeline due to back pressure..
It is important to provision those external systems appropriately (i.e., to handle peak volumes).
Testing external systems against peak volume is not important.
External System doesn't impact performance of a Dataflow pipeline as they are run outside the Dataflow environment.

entry.question: Which two of the following interfaces support Calcite SQL?

option.detail: Dataflow SQL
Beam SQL client
Dataflow template

entry.question: What operations can you do in standard Pandas DataFrames that are not possible in Beam DataFrames?

option.detail: Shift the DataFrame
Write the DataFrame columns as rows
Compute two different aggregates based on the input data

entry.question: Which one of these statements is true?

option.detail: You can use the option include_window_info from ib.show to get extra metadata about each element in a Pcollection.
When using the interactive runner, if you want to play with the values from a PCollection within a dataframe, you must access them from within a DoFn.
When using the interactive runner, you have to create a logging DoFn to see the values of an intermittent PCollection.

entry.question: Which two of the following statements are true about using the interactive runner?

option.detail: You can limit the amount of data the interactive runner records from an unbounded source by setting recording_size_limit.
You can limit the number of elements the interactive runner records from an unbounded source by setting the recording_element_count option.
You can limit the amount of time the interactive runner records data from an unbounded source by using the recording_duration option.
